casebody.data:
The People v. Jesse Burdock and Jonathan Case. AN indictment found against the defendants for a focible entry and detainer, in April terin, 1798, had, on being removed into this court, been quashed, and restitution ordered, but the record of it could not, on search in the clerk’s office, be found. Piker

applied for leave to file a record nunc pro tunó, On an affidavit by the attorney employed in the' prosecution, disclosing the above facts, and that, on an examination of his register, he found not only that a record had been duly filed, but that he actually ob. tained an exemplification of it, which had been lost,"

Granted accordingly.
